reviews:
My husband & I enjoyed walking around Ghirardelli Square. The area is beautiful. I got mint chocolate ice cream in a cone & my husband got a sea salt Carmel quake shake it was amazing! We got our order to go & ate out by the mermaid fountain. People were playing corn hole & lights were hanging in the trees - such a nice area! The Ghirardelli Store give a piece of Easter candy to each person who entered which was a nice little gesture.
Show less
We stopped here to buy souvenirs for home and to have one of their delicious sundaes. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

My wife loves dessert so I thought I'd win husband of the year for this. We had dinner at fisherman's wharf and then walked the four blocks to Ghiradelli Square. The first 2 blocks were fine, the last two were near deserted. Once we got to the square it was pretty empty (We were told Saturday night is the busy time-we were there on a Thursday night). The square is nice, but the dessert was nothing special-don't get me wrong, it was good, just nothing special. We then walked two mostly deserted blocks back to our hotel. The buildings are nice, but beyond the photo op, meh.

Not our thing but worth stopping at...

At the end of a long day we ended up here to see what it was about. It's a cute, trendy shopping area with high end shops and restaurants and if that's what you're looking for it would be just fine. We walked around for a little bit and went thru the Ghirardelli chocolate shop as they were handing out samples which were very tasty. Even if you don't like the shopping, there are plenty of benches and restrooms so great place to recharge and rest if needed.

So may stores in the square for souvenir shoppers, but the Ghiradelli store offers so many chocolates. They give you a sample as you walk in. Very good chocolate.

I walked to Ghirardelli Square from Fisherman’s Wharf. It is a nice collection of upscale shops and Ghirardelli chocolate stores. It smells amazing. The shops weren’t really my cup of tea but it is a nice shopping venue.
Great place for an ice cream and soda treat! Wonderful soda fountain with awesome sundaes! The Ghirardelli chocolate is amazing and the store offers wonderful chocolate treats!
Best ice cream and hot fudge. We went twice! It is a tourist trap, but our kids loved it and it was walkable from Lombard Street.

This is another one of those got to go every time we are in San Francisco places. Hint - order a single scoop and get the free chocolate chips and save $$. Go to the small one on the lower level as (if you are ordering) it has all the same things!! Got chocolate was smooth and delicious. Ice cream comes and sundae’s were also good! We had good timing, only waited about 10 - 15 min. to order. Once we ordered, it wasn’t hard to get a seat and our sundae came fast. It was good, but nothing amazing. My daughter and I shared.

We had a dessert at the Original Ghiradelli's and all I can say is "Well Done!" It was absolutely fantastic! I honestly don't think you can go wrong with a dessert at this place. The staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to make everything perfect. I would give this place a "Must Visit" if you're visiting the city!! BRAVO!!

We stopped at in and did a little sweet shopping. Upon arrival one of the employees gave us a free chocolate to try while we shopped, it convinced us to buy a few tins of pre wrapped bars as well as a couple other small things. Decent pricing and great chocolate we enjoyed our stop. Pro tip- if you arrange them good you can fit 3-4 more chocolates in a tin than most people, and the caramel chocolates are really tasty but take up double space.

You Can Get The Chocolate Anywhere!

It's cute. The chocolate and the ice cream are very good. But it's not really worth a trip out of your way to get chocolate you can get in your local grocery store and ice cream no better than you can get in a lot of other places with more local character. There is a little bit of fake chocolate making display in the store, but there is no tour or anything - it's basically just a store in a nice outdoor mall area.

Chocolate lovers will find refuge in this historic shop by pier 39. You are sure to satisfy your sweet tooth with plenty chocolatey options on the menu. The staff is friendly and there are lots of samples to help you find your favorite flavor. You can find a bit of chocolate history as you wander around tasting the goods.

Two Ghirardelli stores, some fun boutiques, live music, corn hole games, and free samples at the Ghirardelli store. We ended up here in the early evening and it was great to walk around and wind down from a busy day exploring San Francisco. Cute stores to browse. Can watch chocolate making machinery in action too.

My brothers in town and just had to come over to get our dessert on! They also have a neat little square with some shops (including a puppy dog accessory shop.)

We enjoyed our free samples and a yummy Ice Cream Sundae. I wish we could have found more info about how they make the chocolate, but all we found was where we could purchase it. I'm sure they have something somewhere, but we missed it. We loved the little shops, and played a game of Corn Hole.

This place is great. Always a large selection of gifts to bring back to family. Variety is enormous for all taste buds. Can be pricey if you buy any of the gift tins and such but they usually have some half off deals with a larger quantity purchase. Or just buy large bags of what you need. The have small and large amounts of all their chocolate. Cafe tends to get crowded during certain hours but I haven’t noticed a pattern.

Ghirardelli Square is your mecca if you're a chocoholic. Their entire product line is available for purchase here, usually over a couple scoops of ice cream or in a milkshake. There are many restaurants in the surrounding area, but most people forgo their options for dessert and grab something here. If you're unsure what you're looking for, I advise heading upstairs to the tasting room and trying a few different examples of their chocolate squares to see what flavors appeal to you. After you tickle your taste buds, grab a few squares to go in one of their festive tins.

Ghiradelli-SanFrancisco-what else is there to say? A must do! Have the ice cream sundae. Get your free sample at the door. So much chocolate, so much deliciousness!

Well, where do I start. To me, the Wharf means you need to see the Ghirardelli shop, get something chocolate to take home and eat something chocolatey.
We did all that. The Ghirardelli mall is new (at least to me), lovely, lots of shops and great chocolate items.

Don’t miss it. Save your calories for the day to eat something there or you will have missed an excellent opportunity.

If you like chocolate, I would recommend a stop. The sundaes and mochas are excellent, but a bit pricey.
Best cup of hot chocolate anywhere, best sundaes in the world. And a beautiful building and patios to stroll around. On top of all that free chocolate square samples...

A fun place to pop into to.
You always get a free square of chocolate here when you visit. It smells wonderful inside and should always be part of your "walking path" when in San Francisco.
We visited it during Christmas holidays.Nice decoration.Variety of chocolates and tasty ice cream.We enjoyed our afternoon coffee there.One of the places that every visitor of San Francisco must go.

We were so sad to see that almost the entire center is empty. Almost all shops are closed, so walking up to the Ghiradelli store is kinda sad. So boring, nothing was open or did not open on time - we went to the Ghirardelli stores - nothing exciting - just skip it!

I did not try their deserts or ice cream (looong lines - be prepared) but did try a few of their chocolates!

I’m the restaurant, head to the back of the room and look at melting chocolates being prepared!

Chocolates are all quite delicious - especially the ones with sea salt! Yum!

Loved their hot chocolate too!

Lots of Ghirardelli chocolate available. Lots of people wanting to get more of it. Nothing great about it.
The beach just off the square was quiet and a nice setting.

This iconic stop in San Francisco is a few blocks down from the Alcatraz tour. We did the tour, ate at Boudin and walked down here for dessert!

The sign is neon and pops out above the building looking over the water. The walk is flat till you approach the building on a small hill.

There are shops and the main ice cream shop/cafe upstairs. There are steps and the elevator is a bit hard to find but it is there.

We walked around the main level and enjoyed the chilly air, and lovely decorations and lights and made our way to ground level for our ice cream treats where the line was shorter. We had delicious sundaes and milkshakes. The shop help was handing out samples and there were many chocolate gifts to purchase. The outdoor seating was brisk but quieter. Highly recommend.

We popped into Ghriradelli Square before heading back to our hotel one evening. When you walk into the Ghiradelli store, a charming, happy woman was passing out Strawberry white chocolate ~ yum! Neat area with restaurants & shops & cafes near Fisherman's Wharf.

I think that if you want to be a total tourist and enjoy a delicious treat this is the place to go! Not only do you get to enjoy a delicious sundae, but the square itself has some cute little shops to visit and check out. I definitely recommend this place.

No vacation to San Francisco is complete without a stop for ice cream at Ghirardelli Square. The line is always crazy long but moves faster than you think. The sundaes and treats are themed after San Francisco landmarks and are great. I usually get the Crissy Field and share it with my husband. Definitely share the big desserts. There is a little chocolate making demonstration by the kitchen so you can see how their chocolate is made. There is also a retail store that sells the squares, hot chocolate powder, baking chocolate, etc. The is usually someone in the retail store giving out free squares of chocolate. Former headquarters of Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory

Ghirardelli Square is a public square not far from Fisherman’s Wharf.

In the late 1800s to early 1960s this building was the headquarters of the Ghirardelli Chocolate Company. In order to preserve the historical Ghirardelli Square it was listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

The 5 star Fairmont Heritage Place Hotel is located on this site as well as restaurants, bars and Ghirardelli still have a store selling their famous chocolates.

Note:Best to buy chocolates from Walgreens where they can be purchased much cheaper.

National Historic Landmark worth a visit

Now a National Historic Landmark property, Ghirardelli Square dates from 1864. First a factory for making Civil War uniforms, and after 1893 a chocolate factory(sniff the bricks because you can still smell the chocolate), it is now a multilevel mall with restaurants, shops and exclusive condominiums. The Ghirardelli Chocolate Company operates an old fashioned ice cream parlor where the line for service is always out the door. The Nob Hill sundae and hot fudge sundaes are worth the stop.
Panoramic Views of the bridge and bay are excellent. At night the stings of lights around the buildings are lovely. There are frequent street performers at the fountain area and plenty of places to enjoy a drink, including an outdoor beer garden. The Hyde Street Cable Car line stops one block from Ghirardelli Square.
